circumstances: The approach to Bettles Airport was unstable and completed in poor weather conditions with low ceiling, fog and blowing snow. The aircraft crashed on three parked aircraft on apron. The C-47 was destroyed and both pilots were killed. At the time of the accident, the visibility was below minimums.
probable_cause:
Collision with parked aircraft on final approach due to improper IFR operation. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Low ceiling, 
- Fog,
- Blowing snow, 
- Visibility less than half a mile, below minimums, 
- No alternate airport, 
- LOC/DME approach.
